description:
This resource allows you to create and manage CI/CD variables for your GitLab projects.
For further information on variables, consult the [gitlab
documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/ci/variables/README.html#variables).

~> **Important:** If your GitLab version is older than 13.4, you may see nondeterministic behavior
when updating or deleting `gitlab_project_variable` resources with non-unique keys, for example if
there is another variable with the same key and different environment scope. See
[this GitLab issue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/9912).

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

EnvironmentScope.description: The environment_scope of the variable. Defaults to `*`.

Masked.description: If set to `true`, the variable will be masked if it would have been written to the logs. Defaults to `false`.

Project.description: The name or id of the project to add the hook to.

Protected.description: If set to `true`, the variable will be passed only to pipelines running on protected branches and tags. Defaults to `false`.

VariableType.description: The type of a variable. Available types are: env_var (default) and file.
